intro: Polyandra, commonly known as the common polyandra, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory species in tropical forests, thriving in moist, shaded environments. Its roots are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The flowers of Polyandra are usually white or pale yellow, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
